body_html: No, reducing the Adam step size to, e.g., 1e-6 does not help. It just makes the error occur a little later. Neither an excessive gradient nor an excessive variable norm was observed prior to the NaN. Did you manage to reproduce the error?
body_text: No, reducing the Adam step size to, e.g., 1e-6 does not help.  It just makes the error occur a little later.  Neither an excessive gradient nor an excessive variable norm was observed prior to the NaN.  Did you manage to reproduce the error?
